data.enText: to move by jumping on one foot

data.chText: 我有一个脚脖子使不上劲，不得不单脚跳来跳去。
data.enText: I couldn't put my weight on my ankle and had to hop everywhere.

data.chText: 单足跳过水坑的孩子们
data.enText: kids hopping over puddles

before.enText: of an animal or a bird

data.enText: to move by jumping with all or both feet together

data.chText: 一只知更鸟在小路上跳来跳去。
data.enText: A robin was hopping around on the path.
to go or move somewhere quickly and suddenly

data.chText: 快上车吧，我开车送你回家。
data.enText: Hop in, I'll drive you home.

data.chText: 一头钻进被窝；猛然起床
data.enText: to hop into/out of bed
I hopped on the next train.

data.chText: 我们冲到巴黎去过了个周末。
data.enText: We hopped over to Paris for the weekend.
to get on a plane, bus, etc.
to change from one activity or subject to another

data.chText: 我看电视时喜欢不断地转换频道。
data.enText: I like to hop from channel to channel when I watch TV.
hop it
usually used in orders to tell sb to go away
Go on, hop it!
hop to it

data.text: = jump to it at jump v.

data.enText: a short jump by a person on one foot

data.chText: 他来了一个三级跳远穿过了大厅。
data.enText: He crossed the hall with a hop, skip and a jump.

data.chText: （动物或鸟的）齐足（或双足）短距离跳跃
data.enText: a short jump by an animal or a bird with all or both feet together
a short journey, especially by plane
a tall climbing plant with green female flowers that are shaped like cones
the green female flowers of the hop plant that have been dried, used for making beer
a social event at which people dance in an informal way
catch sb on the hop
to surprise sb by doing sth when they are not expecting it and not ready for it

means: (动物或鸟的)齐足(或双足)短距离跳跃

data.enText: hop it
usually used in orders to tell sb to go away
Go on, hop it!
hop to it

data.text: = jump to it at jump v.

data.enText: catch sb on the hop
to surprise sb by doing sth when they are not expecting it and not ready for it

tr: jumping upward or forward (especially on one foot)
an informal dance where popular music is played
twining perennials having cordate leaves and flowers arranged in conelike spikes
the dried flowers of this plant are used in brewing to add the characteristic bitter taste to beer
travel by means of an aircraft, bus, etc.
example: She hopped a train to Chicago
He hopped rides all over the country

tr: make a jump forward or upward
traverse as if by a short airplane trip
move quickly from one place to another

value.def: If you hop, you move along by jumping on one foot.

example.tran: 马尔科姆与其说是用走的不如说是用单脚跳的。

example.ex: 'This really is a catchy rhythm, huh?' he added, with a few little hops.
example.tran: “这个节奏还真想让人跟着跳，是吧？”他说着又小步蹦跶了几下。

value.def: When birds and some small animals hop, they move along by jumping on both feet.

example.ex: A small brown fawn hopped across the trail in front of them.
example.tran: 一只棕色的小鹿蹦跳着穿过他们面前的那条小路。

example.ex: The rabbit got up, took four hops and turned round.
example.tran: 兔子直起身来，蹦跳了4下，又转回头。

value.def: If you hop somewhere, you move there quickly or suddenly.

example.ex: My wife and I were the first to arrive and hopped on board...
example.tran: 我和妻子是最早赶到登船的。

example.ex: I hopped out of bed quickly.

value.def: A hop is a short, quick journey, usually by plane.

example.ex: It is a three-hour drive from Geneva but can be reached by a 20-minute hop in a private helicopter.
example.tran: 从日内瓦开车要3小时，但坐私人直升机只要20分钟就到了。

value.tran: （通常指乘飞机的）短途快速旅程

value.def: A hop is a social event at which people mix together and dance in an informal way.

example.ex: They were afraid of being turned down when they asked girls to dance at high school hops.
example.tran: 他们在中学社交舞会上邀请女孩子跳舞时，害怕会遭到拒绝。

value.def: Hops are flowers that are dried and used for making beer.
If you tell someone to hop it, you are telling them in a rude way to go away.

example.ex: 'Hop it', I snapped at the bloke. 'She's with me.'
example.tran: “滚开，”我厉声对那家伙说，“她是和我一起的。”

value.def: Someone who is hopping mad is very angry.

example.ex: The family's hopping mad that she left them nothing.
example.tran: 这家人因为她什么也没有给他们留下而气得跳脚。

value.tran: 非常生气的;暴跳如雷的

value.def: If you are caught on the hop, you are surprised by someone doing something when you were not expecting them to and so you are not prepared for it.

example.ex: His plans almost caught security chiefs and hotel staff on the hop.
example.tran: 他的计划几乎让安全主管和饭店工作人员都措手不及。

value.tran: 措手不及地;出其不意地

trans: 嘻哈舞曲(由美国黑人兴起，包括说唱和电子乐器演奏)；嘻哈文化(包括艺术、舞蹈、装束等)
措手不及地;出其不意地
嘻哈舞曲(由美国黑人兴起，包括说唱和电子乐器演奏)；嘻哈文化(包括艺术、舞蹈、装束等)
神游舞曲；幻舞；幻觉舞曲；神游
